reviews.review_msg: Great class! Il Professore is top notch and will challenge you to do your best. He teaches independent critical thinking and writing through Italian cinema. If you buy into the process, do the work and participate in discussion, he will reward you. Office hour feedback is great, way better than written comments. If you rely on AI, it won't help.

He is an amazing professor. He's very passionate, and he's very willing to help you. Pick Paul if you don't have a busy semester, and if you like writing.

Don't take his course as an elective. His seminar is 4-hour long, it's hard to keep focus since it's just all talking. No written feedback, only during office hours. Stressful as non-hum major

By far the best professor I have had at SFU. Great lecturer, very passionate, and his workload is very manageable. Participation is a must, but the course content lends itself to discussion, so keep up with the readings and stay engaged. Cannot recommend taking courses with Jamie enough.

Professor Horncastle is one of the best professors I've had at SFU. His lectures are interesting, and you can tell he is passionate about what he teaches! All assignments are provided with clear instructions, and he always provides great feedbacks. He is friendly and open to questions or concerns!

I haven't met a professor who cares more about her students health or general well-being. She would do weekly check-ins with us before class started to make sure everything was ok. I've had her before in a previous class on a Monday morning and she would always start the class with a light-hearted video. Excellent leader, intelligent teacher. 10/10
